name: cody-ai
displayName: Cody: AI Coding Assistant with Autocomplete & Chat
description: AI coding assistant that uses search and codebase context to help you write code faster. Cody brings autocomplete, chat, and commands to VS Code, so you can generate code, write unit tests, create docs, and explain complex code using AI. Choose from the latest LLMs, including GPT-4o and Claude 3.

scripts.dev:desktop: pnpm run -s build:dev:desktop && pnpm run start:dev:desktop
scripts.dev:web: pnpm run -s build:dev:web && pnpm run -s _dev:vscode-test-web --browserType none
scripts.build: pnpm run -s check:build && tsc --build && pnpm run -s _build:esbuild:desktop && pnpm run -s _build:esbuild:web && pnpm run -s _build:webviews --mode production
scripts.check:build: pnpm run -s check:typehacks && pnpm run -s check:manifest
scripts._build:esbuild:desktop: pnpm download-wasm && pnpm run -s _build:esbuild:uninstall && pnpm run -s _build:esbuild:node
scripts.test:e2e: playwright install && tsc --build && node dist/tsc/test/e2e/install-deps.js && pnpm run -s build:dev:desktop && pnpm run -s test:e2e:run
scripts.test:e2e2: pnpm -s test:e2e2:deps && pnpm -s build:dev:desktop && pnpm -s test:e2e2:run
scripts.test:integration: tsc --build ./test/integration && pnpm run -s build:dev:desktop && node --inspect -r ts-node/register dist/tsc/test/integration/main.js

walkthroughs.title: Getting Started with Cody
walkthroughs.description: Discover how Cody can help you write, understand and fix code faster

steps.title: Code Autocomplete
steps.description: Start writing code and Cody will complete the line (or the entire function) for you. Hit tab to accept the suggestion.

steps.title: Cody Chat
steps.description:
Answer questions about general programming topics, or specific to your codebase, with Cody chat.
[Open Chat](command:cody.chat.newEditorPanel)

steps.title: Edit Code
steps.description: Ask Cody to perform code edits with your instructions.

steps.title: Fix Code
steps.description: Use Cody to fix or explain problems in your code.

steps.title: Cody Commands
steps.description:
Discover all the built-in Cody commands, and create your own custom commands.
[Show Commands](command:cody.menu.commands)

steps.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
steps.description:
Easily customize the default keyboard shortcuts to suit your workflow.
[Show Keyboard Shortcuts Editor](command:cody.sidebar.keyboardShortcuts)

steps.title: Ollama (Experimental)
steps.description: Learn how to use your local models with Cody.

colors.description: The background of text Cody will edit where there is a specific conflict with your changes.
The border of text Cody will edit, if there is a conflict with your changes.
The background of text Cody will edit, if there is a conflict with your changes.
The border of text Cody will edit, if there is a conflict with your changes.
The background of text Cody will edit.
The border around text Cody will edit.

commands.title: Get Completions for multiple autocomplete models
Move Chat from Editor to Main Cody Panel
Minion new terminal - temporary test command
Update search index for current workspace folder

commandPalette._comment: Hidden because it is only a wrapper around the workspace pop out command and would place any editor tab (not just Cody chat) in a new window.

cody.serverEndpoint.markdownDeprecationMessage: **Deprecated**: Please sign in via the UI instead. If you are already signed in, you can empty this field to remove this warning.
cody.serverEndpoint.deprecationMessage: Deprecated: Please sign in via the UI instead.

cody.codebase.markdownDescription: A Git repository URL to use instead of allowing Cody to infer the Git repository from the workspace.

cody.useContext.markdownDescription: Controls which context providers Cody uses for chat, commands and inline edits. Use 'blended' for best results. For debugging other context sources, 'embeddings' will use an embeddings-based index if available. 'keyword' will use a search-based index. 'none' will not use embeddings or search-based indexes.

cody.customHeaders.markdownDescription: Adds custom HTTP headers to all network requests to the Sourcegraph endpoint. Defining required headers here ensures requests are properly forwarded through intermediary proxy servers, which may mandate certain custom headers for internal or external communication.

cody.autocomplete.languages.markdownDescription:
Enables or disables code autocompletions for specified [language ids](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/languages/identifiers). `"*"` is the default fallback if no language-specific setting is found.

The default setting: 

```json
{
  "*": true
}
```

To disable autocomplete for a given [language id](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/languages/identifiers#_known-language-identifiers) set its value to `false`, for example:

```json
{
  "*": true,
  "plaintext": false
}
```

cody.commandCodeLenses.markdownDescription: Adds code lenses to current file for quick access to Cody commands.

cody.chat.preInstruction.markdownDescription: A custom instruction to be included at the start of all chat messages (e.g. "Answer all my questions in Spanish.")
examples: Answer all my questions in Spanish.

cody.chat.defaultLocation.markdownDescription: Controls where the Cody chat view opens when the user invokes the `Cody: New Chat` command, or the Alt+L and Alt+/ shortcuts.
enumDescriptions: Opens in the last-activated view location, which is set whenever the user explicitly chooses to open chat in a given location

cody.edit.preInstruction.markdownDescription: A custom instruction to be included at the end of all instructions for edit commands (e.g. "Write all unit tests with Jest instead of detected framework.")
examples: Write all unit tests with Jest instead of detected framework.

cody.codeActions.enabled.title: Cody Code Actions
cody.codeActions.enabled.markdownDescription: Add Cody options to Quick Fix menus for fixing, explaining, documenting, and editing code.

cody.commandHints.enabled.title: Cody Command Hints
cody.commandHints.enabled.markdownDescription: Enable hints for Cody commands such as "Opt+K to Edit" or "Opt+D to Document"

cody.debug.verbose.markdownDescription: Enables verbose debug output. Debug messages may contain more details if the invocation includes verbose information.

cody.debug.filter.markdownDescription: Regular expression to filter debug output. If empty, defaults to '.*', which prints all messages.

cody.telemetry.level.markdownDescription: Controls the telemetry about Cody usage and errors. See [Cody usage and privacy notice](https://about.sourcegraph.com/terms/cody-notice).

cody.autocomplete.advanced.provider.markdownDescription: The provider used for code autocomplete. Most providers other than `anthropic` require the `cody.autocomplete.advanced.serverEndpoint` and `cody.autocomplete.advanced.accessToken` settings to also be set. Check the Cody output channel for error messages if autocomplete is not working as expected.

cody.autocomplete.advanced.serverEndpoin.markdownDescription: The server endpoint used for code autocomplete. This is only supported with a provider other than `anthropic`.

cody.autocomplete.advanced.accessToken.markdownDescription: The access token used for code autocomplete. This is only supported with a provider other than `anthropic`.

cody.autocomplete.advanced.model.markdownDescription: Overwrite the  model used for code autocompletion inference. This is only supported with the `fireworks` provider

cody.autocomplete.completeSuggestWidgetS.markdownDescription: Autocomplete based on the currently selection in the suggest widget. Requires the VS Code user setting `editor.inlineSuggest.suppressSuggestions` set to true and will change it to true in user settings if it is not true.

cody.autocomplete.formatOnAccept.markdownDescription: Format completions on accept using [the default document formatter](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/codebasics#_formatting).

cody.autocomplete.disableInsideComments.markdownDescription: Prevent autocomplete requests while inside code comments.

enumDescriptions: Use folding ranges that are enabled by default in VS Code, and are usually powered by LSP
Use custom implementation of folding ranges that is indentation based. This is the implementation that is used by other Cody clients like the JetBrains plugin
cody.experimental.foldingRanges.markdownDescription: Determines the algorithm Cody uses to detect folding ranges. Cody uses folding ranges for several features like the 'Document code' command

cody.autocomplete.experimental.graphCont.markdownDescription: Use the code graph to retrieve context for autocomplete requests.

cody.autocomplete.experimental.fireworks.markdownDescription: Experimental options for the direct-Fireworks autocomplete provider.

url.description: The URL of the Fireworks API.

token.description: The access token of the Fireworks API.

model.description: The model ID can be acquired from `firectl list deployments`

parameters.description: Parameters for querying the the model.

cody.autocomplete.experimental.ollamaOpt.markdownDescription: Options for the [Ollama](https://ollama.ai/) experimental autocomplete provider.

url.description: The URL of the Ollama API.

parameters.description: Parameters for how Ollama will run the model. See Ollama [PARAMETER documentation](https://github.com/jmorganca/ollama/blob/main/docs/api.md#generate-request-with-options).

cody.autocomplete.experimental.hotStreak.markdownDescription: Changes the debounce time for autocomplete requests based on the amount of time since the last request.

cody.autocomplete.experimental.preloadDe.markdownDescription: Changes the preload debounce interval for autocomplete requests triggered on cursor movement.

cody.internal.unstable.markdownDescription: [INTERNAL ONLY] Enable all unstable experimental features.

untrustedWorkspaces.description: Cody only uses providers (configured in `openctx.providers`) from trusted workspaces because providers may execute arbitrary code.
